result.execSummary:
The defendant Desmound D Cleveland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Jail
IF REVOKED 16 days credit granted

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended

Absolute sobriety, random UA's

Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent

No contact with victim

Anger management/criminal thinking
Full-time employment and/or combination of schooling

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Desmound D Cleveland

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case called at 2:48 p.m.
Intern Jack Rieder in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Desmound D Cleveland. 
Defendant Desmound D Cleveland in court.  
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
45-DAYS JAIL
16-days Credit, if Revoked
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  1 YEAR
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
Full-Time employment and/or combination of schooling
No contact with: victim
Anger Management/Criminal Thinking

COSTS:  $243.00
Domestic Abuse Surcharge:  $100.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
